page.title: 08THE ERIDGE ESTATE
page.content: The Eridge Estate covers five and a half thousand acres. There are seven tenanted farms on the Estate. Lord Abergavenny decided to give up keeping cattle but still has sheep and a few deer in the woods. As well as grazing land there is some arable land too. Altogether Lord Abergavenny has ten workers working for him. He used to have nine foresters but only has two now; there were lots of gardeners, but now he only has one gardener and Lord Abergavenny's wife to do the garden. It is a very big garden so it doesn't look as good as is used to! Events and charites are held quite often and sometimes the garden is open to the public. Many riding events are held like three-day-events and sponsored rides, also non-equestrian events like garden fetes.
